algorithm:
Algorithm: 

The new algorithm assigns scores to the bins based on the product of the ratio of the inverse of the logarithm of the item size to the logarithm of the rest capacities of each bin, and a penalty factor based on the logarithm of the inverse of the rest capacity of each bin. The final scores are adjusted to ensure self-consistency by normalizing them to the sum of the adjusted scores.

Code:

```
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    inverse_item_size = 1 / item
    
    # Calculate the penalty factor dynamically based on the logarithm of the inverse of the rest capacity of each bin
    penalty_factor = np.log(1 / bins)
    
    # Calculate the adjusted scores based on the product of the ratio of the inverse of the logarithm of the item size to the logarithm of the rest capacities of each bin, and the penalty factor
    adjusted_scores = (inverse_item_size / np.log(bins)) * penalty_factor
    
    # Normalize the adjusted scores to ensure self-consistency
    scores = adjusted_scores / np.sum(adjusted_scores)
    
    return scores
